definition: A term commonly employed to refer to the entirety of space, including all matter, energy, and celestial bodies, as well as the laws and principles governing them. It is often used in scientific and philosophical contexts to describe the vast expanse of the cosmos and the universe as a whole.

examples.german: Die Entstehung des Universums ist ein Rätsel.
examples.english: The origin of the universe is a mystery.

examples.german: Das Universum besteht aus Milliarden von Galaxien.
examples.english: The universe consists of billions of galaxies.

examples.german: Die Erforschung des Universums ist ein wichtiger Bereich der Astronomie.
examples.english: The exploration of the universe is an important area of astronomy.

examples.german: Das Universum dehnt sich ständig aus.
